H0.text: Ozone is the substance necessary for burning to take place.

H1.text: Oxygen is the substance necessary for burning to take place.

H2.text: Hydrogen is the substance necessary for burning to take place.

H3.text: Carbon dioxide is the substance necessary for burning to take place.

A4.text: Combustion, or burning, is a high-temperature exothermic redox chemical reaction between a fuel (the reductant) and an oxidant, usually atmospheric oxygen

A5.text: Oxidants for combustion have high oxidation potential and include atmospheric or pure oxygen

A6.text: Concentrated O2 will allow combustion to proceed rapidly and energetically.

A7.text: The 1967 fire that killed the Apollo 1 crew in a launch pad test spread so rapidly because the capsule was pressurized with pure O2 at slightly more than atmospheric pressure to force the doors against their seals.
